title: Probability
prompt:
A fundraiser lottery draws two winners each month from 50 tickets numbered
1 through 50. Margery always puts her age, 34, on her lottery ticket and enters
it into the lottery. This month, the number 5 is drawn first and removed from the
lottery. What is the probability of drawing the number 34 on the second draw?
hint: Probability is the ratio of the desired event, to the total possible events.
feedback:
When the first number is drawn, it is removed from the pool. When the number 5 is taken away, there are 49 numbers remaining: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and all the numbers up to 50. So, there are 49 possible outcomes of the draw. There is one desired outcome, the number 34. The probability of drawing the number 34 are 1 in 49, one desired outcome out of 49 possible outcomes. The probability of drawing any particular number on the second draw is <math>
 <mrow>
<mfrac>
<mn>1</mn>
<mn>49</mn>
</mfrac>
</mrow>
</math>.
